026package com.ibm.streams.function.samples.jvm;
027
028import java.lang.management.ManagementFactory;
029
030import com.ibm.streams.function.model.Function;
031
032public class SystemFunctions {
033    
034    /**
035     * Only expose the static methods.
036     */
037    private SystemFunctions() {}
038    
039    /**
040     * Returns the Java virtual machine implementation name. 
041     * @return The Java virtual machine implementation name.
042     */
043    @Function(description="Returns the Java virtual machine implementation name.")
044    public static String getVmName() {
045        return ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean().getVmName();
046    }
047    /**
048     * Returns the Java virtual machine implementation vendor.
049     * @return The Java virtual machine implementation vendor
050     */
051    @Function(description="Returns the Java virtual machine implementation vendor.")
052    public static String getVmVendor() {
053        return ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean().getVmVendor();
054    }
055    /**
056     * Returns the Java virtual machine implementation version.
057     * @return The Java virtual machine implementation version
058     */
059    @Function(description="Returns the Java virtual machine implementation version.")
060    public static String getVmVersion() {
061       return ManagementFactory.getRuntimeMXBean().getVmVersion();
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Request garbage collection for the Java virtual machine.
066     */
067    @Function(stateful=true, // Stateful as it modified state outside the function
068            description="Request garbage collection for the Java virtual machine.")
069    public static void gc() {
070        System.gc();
071    }
072    
073    /**
074     * Request running of {@code Object.finalize()} for
075     * objects pending garbage collection in the Java virtual machine.
076     */
077    @Function(stateful=true, // Stateful as it modified state outside the function
078            description="Request running of `Object.finalize()` for objects pending garbage collection in the Java virtual machine.")
079    public static void runFinalization() {
080        Runtime.getRuntime().runFinalization();
081    }
082    
083    /**
084     * Return the number of processors available to
085     * the Java virtual machine.
086     * 
087     * Calls {@code Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors()}.
088     * 
089     * @return Return the number of processors available to
090     * the Java virtual machine.
091     */
092    @Function(stateful=true, // Stateful as it might return different values
093            description="Return the number of processors available to the Java virtual machine.") 
094    public static int availableProcessors() {
095        return Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors();
096    }
097    
098    /**
099     * Returns the amount of free memory (in bytes) in the Java Virtual Machine. 
100     * Calls {@code Runtime.getRuntime().freeMemory()}.
101     * @return The amount of free memory in the Java Virtual Machine.
102     */
103    @Function(stateful=true, // Stateful as it might return different values
104            description="Returns the amount of free memory (in bytes) in the Java Virtual Machine.")
105    public static long freeMemory() {
106        return Runtime.getRuntime().freeMemory();
107    }
108    
109    /**
110     * Returns the total amount of memory in the Java virtual machine. 
111     * Calls {@code Runtime.getRuntime().totalMemory()}.
112     * @return The total amount of memory in the Java virtual machine. 
113     */
114    @Function(stateful=true, // Stateful as it might return different values
115            description="Returns the total amount of memory in the Java virtual machine.")
116    public static long totalMemory() {
117        return Runtime.getRuntime().totalMemory();
118    }
119    /**
120     * Returns the maximum amount of memory that the Java virtual machine will
121     * attempt to use. 
122     * Calls {@code Runtime.getRuntime().maxMemory()}.
123     * @return The maximum amount of memory that the Java virtual machine will
124     * attempt to use.
125     */
126    @Function(stateful=true, // Stateful as it might return different values
127            description="Returns the maximum amount of memory that the Java virtual machine will attempt to use.")
128    public static long maxMemory() {
129        return Runtime.getRuntime().maxMemory();
130    }
131}
